result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth F Sherman

records.addlTxt: letter dated October 27, 2022 from Bond Poster regarding Bond money

9:14 AM Defendant Kenneth F Sherman not in court.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant. 
Court orders warrant. No bond. Current cash bond may be forfeited.
Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

9:03 AM Defendant Kenneth F Sherman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions defendant if he wishes to do his appearance by video or he can be transported to Court so he can do an in-person hearing.
Defendant states that he does not wish to enter a plea today, but wishes to address bond. He asks that bond be reduced as his probation agent wants to get him into day treatment. State will not object to bond being reduced to $500 cash.
Court reduces bond to $400 cash with same conditions.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:15 PM Defendant Kenneth F Sherman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant still wishes to represent himself, court informs him how he can get an attorney if he wants one.
Officer Deputy Johnson is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to making a traffic stop due to the license plate not matching the vehicle it was registered to. Testifies to the defendant being the driver. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to the defendant giving him an alias name when he was stopped. Testifies to the defendant having an active warrant. Testifies to the defendant fleeing and being detained shortly after. Testifies to taking the defendant to the hospital. Testifies to when the defendant was booked into the jail, they found a substance in a baggy in the defendants shoe. Testifies to the defendant stating it was meth. Testifies to testing the substance and the results. 

Attorney Mogard requests the court take Judicial Notice of a Marathon County case. Court grants.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:47 PM Defendant Kenneth F Sherman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.
Absolute sobriety No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
